result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William J. Scott

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William J Scott in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant William J Scott in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF247, 14CF452, 15CF12, 15CF47, 15CF48, 15CF84
9:05 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
  Indicates there will be uncharged read-ins as well. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF247 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
15CF12 Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST
15CF47 Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST
15CF48 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty to the following:
14CF247 Count 1 
15CF12 Counts 1 & 2 
15CF47 Counts 1 & 2
15CF48 Count 1 
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Convictions this date.

14CF452 is dismissed and read-in. 
15CF12 Count 3 is dismissed and read-in. 
15CF48 Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. 
15CF84 is dismissed and read-in. 
Uncharged read-in to be provided to defense in writing.  That is to be done before the sentencing. 


Court orders a PSI. 
PSI to be completed by 12/11/2015 with copies forwarded to counsel so they can prepare for sentencing. 
Court orders that all bonds are revoked.

Defendant William J Scott in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Defendant William J Scott in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF247, 14CF452, 15CF12, 15CF47, 15CF48, 15CF84

Atty Molepske makes statements.  Defendant will not be entering a plea. 
Atty Halverson indicates the defendant has some questions. 

2:07 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond & Conditions of Bond are continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for William J. Scott
Current: 119 W North St, Plainfield, WI 54966-9289 United States  (Effective: 07-27-2015)
Prior: 7771 County Road A, Almond, WI 54909 United States

ADDRESS INFO for William J. Scott
Current: 7771 County Road A, Almond, WI 54909 United States  (Effective: 07-22-2015)
Prior: 7771 Cty Rd A, Almond, WI 54909

$15,000 cash bond to cover all files 14CF247, 14CF452, 15CF12, 15CF47, 15CF48, 15CF84.   If posts bond, also maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

1:35 p.m. Prosecuting Atty Louis J. Molepske appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant William J Scott appeared by video. Cases # 14CF247, 14CF452, 15CF12, 15CF47, 15CF48, 15CF84.  Warrants quashed.
Court questions reasons for not appearing prior for court.  DA requests $25,000 cash bond.

BTC: $15,000 cash bond to cover all files 14CF247, 14CF452, 15CF12, 15CF47, 15CF48, 15CF84.   If posts bond, also maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.

2:07 p.m. Attorney Anne Renc in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews file there is a writ in the file.  Jake will call jail and find out if he is there.  ADA Cousins states there is a note in his file stating the writ was returned as Defendant not in custody there.  Sgt Wills confirms the Defendant is not in our jail.  State requests a criminal warrant.  Court reviews file.  BTC: Criminal Warrant - body only

Attorney Halverson for Anne Renc in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Halverson informs the Court that the Defendant is in Intreatment program until 05-06-15.  BTC: Matter rescheduled.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
